Subjective: Neck spot x2 weeks. Initially thought wart, now unsure. Scabbing on/off. Recent insect bite nearby. Itching. No pain. Past: ear abscess. Family Hx: skin cancers (father's side). Concern: Could be cancer. Request: Evaluation and treatment. Social: No smoking mentioned.
Objective: Spot: 0.5cm, raised, pinkish-red, central red spot. Flaking/scabbing. No lymphadenopathy. No other spots.
Assessment: Possible pyogenic granuloma or atypical mole. Ruled out: Wart, insect bite reaction alone.
Plan: 1. Dermatology e-consultation. 2. Patient to follow up Friday for advice. 3. Discuss treatment options (cryotherapy, excision, or shave removal). 4. Consider biopsy for histopathology.
